oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Hallmarks of Country Music - Skeeter Davis
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: The recording is of an interview of Skeeter Davis (musician). The interview is hosted by Rick Phillips (army sergeant/ radio host) for the Hallmarks of Country Music segment. The tape was recorded on an unidentified date.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Skeeter Davis; Rick Phillips
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Promotion for Hallmarks of Country Music featuring Rick Phillips introducing Skeeter Davis -- (00:48) Hallmarks tune [featuring Rick Phillips introduction voiceover] ([Unidentified]) -- (01:20) Michigan Vietnam era veteran's bonus commercial spot hosted by Phillips -- (02:17) Crib death commercial spot hosted by and unidentified host -- (03:14) I Forgot More Than You'll Ever Know (About Him) (Skeeter Davis) -- (05:45) Planned Parenthood commercial spot hosted by an unidentified host -- (06:15) What Does it Take to Keep a Man Like You Satisfied (Skeeter Davis) -- (08:52) Phillips inquires about "What Does it Take to Keep a Man Like You Satisfied," and Davis reflects on not singing in a club where people drink -- (10:55) I Can't Stay Mad at You (Skeeter Davis) -- (13:00) Army Reserve radio spot hosted by an unidentified group -- (14:11) One Tin Solider (Skeeter Davis) -- (17:13) Phillips inquires about Davis' inspiration for "One Tin Solider," and Davis reflects on the concerns of releasing the same record as someone else -- (22:33) Gonna Get Along Without You Now (Skeeter Davis) -- (24:40) An unidentified host performs a dishonorable discharge radio spot -- (25:16) I'm a Lover Not a Fighter (Skeeter Davis) -- (27:36) Love commercial spot hosted by Steve Allen -- (28:26) I Will (Skeeter Davis) -- (30:55) Skeeter reflects on working with Ernest Tubb and the Grand Ole Opry -- (35:42) There's a Fool Born Every Minute (Skeeter Davis) -- (37:57) January recruiting goals radio spot hosted by Phillips -- (38:38) Something Precious (Skeeter Davis) -- (40:46) M. O. S. career management radio spot hosted by Phillips -- (41:13) I Can't Help You (I'm Falling Too) (Skeeter Davis) -- (43:51) Davis reflects on "I Can't Help You (I'm Falling Too)" being an answer to Jeannie Black; additionally, Davis' international popularity is discussed -- (48:30) The End of the World (Skeeter Davis) -- (51:04) Cal Smith hosts an army commercial spot -- (51:40) I Can't Believe it's All Over (Skeeter Davis) -- (53:55) Hallmarks outro tune [featuring Rick Phillips outro voiceover] ([Unidentified]) -- (56:02) Phillips introduces next weeks guest: Moe Bandy -- (56:14) I Just Started Hatin' Cheating Songs Today (Moe Bandy) -- (58:59) Phillips and Bandy converse about 'honky-tonk' music -- (1:00:31) Hallmarks tune ([Unidentified])
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:isPartOf: Insert is of program information. The insert features time stamps.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Davis, Skeeter; Phillips, Rick;
